text.section:
Subject to the limitations in this subtitle, an individual may qualify for a reciprocal license from the State Board if the individual:
holds a license from a local jurisdiction of the State to provide electrical services in the local jurisdiction;
applies for a reciprocal license of the same class or type that the State Board issues; and
at the time of application, does not have:
the same class or type of license suspended or revoked by a local jurisdiction of the State; or
a record of outstanding violations of the regulations of a local jurisdiction of the State.

The State Board shall waive any of the qualifications required for a license under this title for an individual who:
holds a license, from a local jurisdiction of the State, of the same class or type as the license for which the applicant is seeking a waiver; and
meets the waiver requirements of subsection (c) of this section.

The State Board shall grant a waiver under this section for an applicant who holds a license from a local jurisdiction only if the applicant:
submits a written statement from the local jurisdiction certifying:
if the license is issued on the basis of an examination, the date of issuance of the license; and
the licensee:
pays any reciprocal license fee required under this title;
if required, submits proof of general liability insurance to the State Board; and
complies with any other licensing requirements of the State Board.
